text:
William Edward "Bill" Phipps (February 4, 1922 – June 1, 2018) was a retired American actor and producer. He was best known for his roles in dozens of classic sci-fi and westerns, both in movies and on television. He was known for making the voice of Prince Charming in Walt Disney's "Cinderella" (1950).
Phipps died at his home in Santa Monica, California from complications of lung cancer on June 1, 2018 at the age of 96.
